primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The 'Strategy of the Skies': Christ descends from eternal glory into human suffering and death to secure salvation, subsequently being exalted by God.

tekstueel_bewijs: He made himself of no reputation
He traded the praise of angels for the curses of men
This is salvation history, in two or three sentences
In your interest and in mine
Wherefore God also hath highly exalted him
In your name and in my name

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit (implied) / The Apostle Paul (as reporter)

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death is described as a 'specter' and 'ominous ghost' that only Christ can overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the believer to the humility of Christ, specifically regarding racial reconciliation and communal honesty.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Nation
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Humility and confession of sin (specifically racism)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The preacher uses the 'mind of Christ' as the ground for the 'due response' of human humility.

voorbeelden_god_subject: He made himself of no reputation
God also hath highly exalted him
He became time trapped... for you
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We have not been willing to admit it
We will never heal the breach until we humbly recognize the chasm

voorbeelden: secure from us a fitting reverence and a due response
we should have put this specter behind us
we have not been willing to admit it
so that you will be able to know... when you are old
we have no hope apart from Jesus Christ

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the total inability (non-pouvoir) of man to face death or solve social sin without the power of Christ.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S1 (Christ's glory) to S2 (Cross) to ~S2 (Humanity's false dignity) back to S1 (Resurrection hope).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ occupies S2 (Death) so that the Receiver can move from ~S1 (Pride) to S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; death is described as 'public shame' and 'melancholy'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon contains strong ethical imperatives regarding racism, they are framed as a 'due response' to the primary actantial work of Christ. Christ remains the Subject of the salvific verbs.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus humbled himself... [therefore] we have not been willing to admit our great fault.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Christ as sole Subject of salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He traded the praise of angels for the curses of men.
Was it for crimes that I had done He groaned upon the tree?

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Christ's humility is used as a model for national and communal confession.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ's humility is not just a model but the ontological destruction of the pride that fuels racism.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Comfort in the face of mortality; conviction regarding social sin.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Strategy of the Skies' to the 'Street Corners of Detroit' is logically linked by the theme of humility.
spanning_punten: The long introductory anecdotes about personal friends slightly delay the narrative engine.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: In your name and in my name, he forfeited that dignity.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the source of 'Pouvoir'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is a 'sleeping serpent' and an 'ominous ghost'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is structurally sound, keeping Christ as the Subject of the primary program while deriving a secondary ethical program from His character.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might feel they must 'produce' humility to trigger grace.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that Christ's humility creates the capacity for ours.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong Devoir in the middle section.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (Spirit's power) in the ethical section.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Link the 'mind of Christ' to the indwelling Spirit rather than just a mental imitation.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly depicted as death and systemic racism.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Maintain the current order: Christ's descent -> Our need -> Our hope.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in Christocentric preaching that does not shy away from social application.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the pathos of the golf course story; Greimas focuses on how that story positions the hearer as a 'disappearing mortal' in need of a 'Subject' who survives death.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek of Phil 2; Greimas explains how the sermon functions as a 'salvation engine' for the listener.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'racism' section is not a detour but a necessary 'Opponent' that proves the hearer's lack of 'Pouvoir'.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'If-Then' trap of moralism.
